metadata.Title: CVE-2021-3286 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Certified (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
SQL injection exists in Spotweb 1.4.9 because the notAllowedCommands protection mechanism is inadequate, e.g., a variation of the payload may be used. NOTE: this issue exists because of an incomplete fix for CVE-2020-35545.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-3286` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

spotweb - 20130826+dfsg3-4
No subscription required

criterions.comment: spotweb package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '20130826+dfsg3-4').
